content: Regular exercise is important for maintaining a healthy heart. Physical activity can help strengthen the heart and improve cardiovascular function. This is achieved by increasing blood flow and strengthening the heart muscle. When the heart works more efficiently, it pumps blood more effectively, which can lead to lower blood pressure and a reduced risk of heart disease. Regular exercise also improves the overall health of the cardiovascular system, which includes the heart and blood vessels. This is because physical activity helps to reduce the buildup of plaque in the arteries, a major risk factor for heart disease. Exercise can also increase levels of high-density lipoprotein (HDL), the "good" cholesterol, which helps remove the "bad" cholesterol from the bloodstream and reduce the risk of heart disease (Source: American Heart Association).
